div.p: Georg, Count of Württemberg and Mömpelgard (Montbéliard) etc.

Our greetings to you first, dear friend, we are sending you the person, whose name the request for explanation and answer, which was presented before the Landgrave, our father Landgrave Philip etc. in Innsbruck, out of good gracious intent, so that if you do not have it as truthfully, to read it with the distressed and let us have it returned to us as soon as possible and without delay, as we completely trust you. Be entrusted to God. Given by our hand on the 19th of December in Schaffhausen in the year 51.
We would have sent you the honor and eight days ago, a distressed good friend prevented us from reading it (and not the time at home).
[To our] dear friend [Heinrich Bul]linger, [pre]acher [... i]n Zurich, to hand.
